titleInfo.title: ‘File 7/24 Lease of R.A.F. land to A.I.O.C. [Anglo-Iranian Oil Company]’

physicalDescription.extent: The contents of the file are arranged in approximate chronological order, from the earliest items at the front of the file to the latest at the end. Circled index numbers written in blue/red crayon can also be found throughout the file, and refer to the office notes towards the end of the file (folios 13-14).

Foliation: The foliation sequence begins on the front cover and ends on the back cover; these numbers are written in pencil, and can be found in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. The following foliation anomalies occur: 1, 1A, and 1B.

mods.abstract: The papers in the file relate to a request made by the Anglo-Iranian Oil Company [AIOC] to lease land belonging to the Air Ministry at Qadhibia [Qudaibiya], on the outskirts of Manama. A decision on the lease was deferred by the Political Agent in Bahrain (Lieutenant-Colonel Arnold Crawshaw Galloway), until confirmation of where the British Residency was to be located in Bahrain was confirmed. A map showing the plot of land in question, which states that the land was sold, not leased, by the Government of Bahrain to the Government of Great Britain, is included in the file (folio 16).
